Variables

{% raw %} 
SUBREDDIT = 'askreddit'
LIMIT = 100_000
YEARS = [year for year in range(2006, 2021)]
YEAR = 2010
{% endraw %}

Imports

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Google Cloud Storage authentication

CREDS = f'{os.getcwd()}/google-drive-d2e64a7dbc90.json' %env GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS=$CREDS

Get file paths

per lexeme

{% raw %}

get_fpaths_lex[source]

get_fpaths_lex(LEX, CORPUS_DIR='data/', source='local', bucket_name='socemb')

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
fpaths_lex = get_fpaths_lex('Anglo-Saxon', source='local')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
fpaths_lex

['data/Anglo-Saxon/Anglo-Saxon_2006-02-04--2020-08-13.csv',
 'data/Anglo-Saxon/Anglo-Saxon_2019-12-31--2020-10-06.csv']
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert len(fpaths_lex) == 2
{% endraw %}

per subreddit (and year)

{% raw %}

get_fpath_subr_yr[source]

get_fpath_subr_yr(SUBREDDIT, LIMIT, YEAR)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
get_fpath_subr_yr('askreddit', 100_000, 2009) == 'data/subreddit/askreddit/100000_2009.csv'

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_fpaths_subr_yrs[source]

get_fpaths_subr_yrs(SUBREDDIT, LIMIT, YEARS)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert len(get_fpaths_subr_yrs(SUBREDDIT, LIMIT, YEARS)) == 14
{% endraw %}

per year

{% raw %}

get_fpaths_yr[source]

get_fpaths_yr(YEAR, DIR='data/subreddit/')

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
get_fpaths_yr(2010)

[PosixPath('data/subreddit/asklibertarians/100000_2010.csv'),
 PosixPath('data/subreddit/askaconservative/100000_2010.csv'),
 PosixPath('data/subreddit/politics/100000_2010.csv'),
 PosixPath('data/subreddit/politics/10000_2010.csv'),
 PosixPath('data/subreddit/politics/1000_2010.csv'),
 PosixPath('data/subreddit/politics/100_2010.csv'),
 PosixPath('data/subreddit/askreddit/100000_2010.csv')]
{% endraw %}

Read comments

Read 1 comments csv file

{% raw %} 
fpath = get_fpath_subr_yr('askreddit', 100_000, 2009)
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

read_comm_csv[source]

read_comm_csv(fpath)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
comments = read_comm_csv(fpath)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
comments.info()

<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>
Int64Index: 99999 entries, 0 to 99999
Data columns (total 4 columns):
 #   Column       Non-Null Count  Dtype         
---  ------       --------------  -----         
 0   body         99999 non-null  string        
 1   created_utc  99999 non-null  datetime64[ns]
 2   id           99999 non-null  string        
 3   subreddit    99999 non-null  string        
dtypes: datetime64[ns](1), string(3)
memory usage: 3.8 MB
{% endraw %}

Read multiple comment csv files
